name: Anders Miltner
content: Anders Miltner About I am an Assistant Professor in Programming Languages at SFU's Computing Science department. I am looking for interested students to join my group. Read more here. CMPT 383 Students, go here. Research Interests I am very interested in how program synthesis can change how programmers interact with computers. I believe tools can automate many programming tasks, allowing programmers to spend less time on tedious aspects of code, and more time on implementing core algorithms. Current Projects Burst - Bottom-up synthesis of functional programs from logical specifications. Hanoi - Generating representation invariants for data structure verification through a data-driven algorithm. Type-Directed Refactorings - Still looking for a cool name for this project. Enable robust refactorings based on types, rather than syntax. Students PhD Students Clement Wan Ellenor Taghayor Ziyi Yan Shreyas Athreya Venkatesh MSc Students Jimmy Chen Chen Nazanin Yousefian Undergrad Students Arthur Li Alumni David Weibe Past Projects Saggitarius - Inducing grammars within user-described domains. Optician - Synthesizing data synchronization transformations from regular expression specifications and input output examples. Blue-Pencil - Synthesizing repetitive document edits from observing user interactions with that document.
